title: 10 More Gamers Who Achieved The IMPOSSIBLE
description:
Some players go to amazing lengths to achieve the impossible in video games. Here are some more of our favorite examples of top tier gaming.
Subscribe for more: https://www.youtube.com/gameranxTV?sub_confirmation=1

SOURCES & REFERENCES

10. Beat Halo 2 on the highest difficulty setting, with every skull activated, without dying 
(aka the LASO deathless challenge)
https://kotaku.com/halo-2-deathless-laso-skulls-jervalin-crt1tikal-20k-1849371594




9. Beat Dark Souls 3 without taking a single hit... with a guitar hero controller 
https://gamerant.com/dark-souls-3-guitar-hero-no-hit-video-clip-twitch/#:~:text=MezzPlays%20went%20through%20the%20entirety,so%20at%20an%20astonishing%20speed.



8. Someone beat every main assassin's creed game without getting hit - that's 12 games and it took 9 months to do, nearly 950 hours! 

https://www.gamepressure.com/newsroom/1000-hours-spent-on-no-hit-run-through-all-assassins-creed-games/zc42ea



7. Mined (almost) everything in minecraft! 

https://www.pcgamesn.com/minecraft/minecraft-map-mining




6. Luke Steelman obtained the 'impossible arrow' in Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild 

https://kotaku.com/botw-zelda-impossible-arrow-shock-nintendo-switch-legen-1848412649

someone also managed to open an 'impossible chest' - this was easier, somehow

https://kotaku.com/breath-of-the-wild-player-opens-the-games-final-impossi-1847206007



5. This Pacifist run in WoW reached max level by only picking flowers 


https://www.pcgamer.com/world-of-warcrafts-pacifist-panda-just-hit-level-60-by-picking-millions-of-flowers/





4. The guy who got to level 99 without leaving the first area in final fantasy 7 - took years of dedication 

https://www.theverge.com/tldr/2017/4/11/15255852/final-fantasy-vii-level-99-reactor-circlmastr-meaning-life

Cybershell video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MBfnQcFNCp4



3. Lynx Titan was the first ever to achieve maximum 200M exp in every skill in the game, which took at least 30,000+ hours to achieve at maximum efficiency -Alek Anderson, youtube comment 

https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/200_million_experience 





2. Asheron's call had the 'shard of the herald' event where players on the Thistledown server managed to do the impossible and beat the devs 

https://asheron.fandom.com/wiki/The_Shard_of_the_Herald

https://massivelyop.com/2018/01/30/re-examining-the-significance-of-asherons-calls-shard-of-the-herald-event-on-its-first-deathiversary/



1. Turned Super Mario World in Pong using only button inputs 

https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2014/01/how-an-emulator-fueled-robot-reprogrammed-super-mario-world-on-the-fly/




BONUS
___________________________________________________________________________


 Sadfuego 'finds' an unknown secret area in Nier: Automata 

https://www.reddit.com/r/Games/comments/w7yci2/reddit_user_usadfutago_posts_video_of_them/

https://www.gamesradar.com/nier-automatas-secret-church-mystery-was-the-result-of-unprecedented-new-modding-tools/

-it was a mod, but modding the game to this extent was previously thought to be impossible

title: Why is Saints Row Getting SO MUCH HATE?
description:
Saints Row (PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X/S/One) has received some backlash from fans and critics. Let's take a look at what's going on.
Subscribe for more: https://www.youtube.com/gameranxTV?sub_confirmation=1
